intro: Seseli fedtschenkoanum, commonly known as the Fedtschenko's seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered umbels of white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a silvery or grayish hue. It is native to regions of Central Asia, including parts of Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan.
